newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft's Gates pitches new box - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft's Gates pitches new box - WSJ.

text.p: Bill Gates, chairman of Microsoft Corp, held meetings with cable executives Monday in New York to pitch a new kind of television set-top box, The Wall Street Journal said.
In its Tuesday electronic edition, the paper said the pitch was the company's latest effort in its long-standing attempt to build a franchise in consumers' living rooms.
The newspaper said the information for the story came from people familiar with the situation.
Microsoft is proposing a design for a digital device that would connect to TV sets and cable systems to provide a variety of interactive programming, the paper said.
